meanings.sent1: She disaccustomed herself to the new routine after moving to a different city.
meanings.sent2: The traveler disaccustomed himself to the local customs of the foreign country.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed disaccustomed to the presence of the new puppy in the house.
meanings.sent4: His taste buds were disaccustomed to the spicy food of the region.
meanings.sent5: The students were disaccustomed to the strict rules of the new school.

meanings.definition: No longer accustomed or used to something.
meanings.sent1: The disaccustomed child felt lost in the bustling city.
meanings.sent2: She felt disaccustomed to the cold weather after living in a tropical climate.
meanings.sent3: The disaccustomed dog struggled to remember where he buried his bone.
meanings.sent4: His disaccustomed hands fumbled with the unfamiliar tool.
meanings.sent5: The disaccustomed taste of the exotic fruit surprised her palate.
